description: Beryl strengthened from a tropical storm into a hurricane on Saturday as the storm makes its way through the southeast Caribbean. It is expected to become a major hurricane.
title: Early in the hurricane season, an unusually strong storm moves through the Caribbean

description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with New York Times columnist Thomas Friedman about why he thinks President Biden should step aside in the 2024 election.
title: Should President Biden step aside in the 2024 election?

description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with law professor Jody Freeman about what the Supreme Court's overturning of the Chevron case means for how federal agencies can regulate.
title: The Supreme Court overruled decades of administrative law. What happens now?

description: In Minneapolis this week, the best gymnasts in the U.S. are competing to make the team that will compete at next month's Olympics in Paris. Simone Biles aims to make her third Summer Games.
title: U.S. gymnastics Olympic trials take place in Minneapolis

description: A disparate group of left-wing and Green parties unites to fight France's far-right in legislative elections.
title: Ahead of parliamentary elections, the French left unites against the right

description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with journalist Alana Schreiber and comedian Roy Wood Jr. about their new podcast, "Road to Rickwood," which documents the history of Rickwood Field in Alabama.
title: 'Road to Rickwood' tells the story of Alabama's famed Rickwood Field

description: Three Jewish women challenged Kentucky's near-total abortion ban on the grounds that it infringed on their religious beliefs that life begins at birth, not conception.
title: Kentucky judge throws out Jewish mothers' lawsuit challenging the state's abortion ban

description: Efforts to make the world’s biggest music festival sustainable affect everything from trash pickup to wheelchair access to child safety. Is it possible for 200,000+ campers to "leave no trace?"
title: Can the world's largest music festival be sustainable? Glastonbury is trying

description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben asks Harvard Law professor Andrew Mergen about the Supreme Court's decision to overrule the "Chevron doctrine."
title: After Roe v Wade, Supreme Court overturns another major legal precedent

description: On Friday, the U.S. Supreme Court issued an opinion in a case centered in Grants Pass, Ore., that will impact homelessness policy across the West. It might have less impact in Grants Pass due to an Oregon state law that passed in 2021.
title: Supreme Court upholds Oregon city’s ban on homeless people camping in public spaces

description: The reverberations from Thursday's presidential debate continue, alongside consequential Supreme Court rulings.
title: Week in politics: Presidential debate, Supreme Court decisions

description: Business Insider's Polly Thompson tells NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben about the controversy surrounding Dell's return-to-office policies.
title: Dell's return to office policy is raising questions about the future of work

description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben and Meadowlark Media's Howard Bryant discuss the NBA draft and Olympic doping.
title: Saturday Sports: NBA draft, Olympic doping

description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben speaks to Hussein Ibish, a senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Institute, about Hamas’ strategy for the war in Gaza.
title: What is Hamas' strategy for a ceasefire and conditions for the end of war?

description: One day after facing off on the debate stage, President Biden and former President Donald Trump held campaign rallies that built off of Thursday's debate performance.
title: In a post-debate rally, Biden showcases a different side

description: Why Sen. John Fetterman, D-Pa., visited Israel this week, and how the visit underscores tensions among Democrats over the war in Gaza.
title: Fetterman traveled to Israel and met with Netanyahu despite blowback on the left

description: Here's a selection of finalists for the Siena Drone Photo Award competition of 2024: a wrestling match, an awesome bridge, a snow-covered village and pelicans!
title: Wow! These amazing drone's-eye views of our world are up for best drone photo

description: Relatives of overdose victims felt uncertainty and frustration after the Supreme Court overturned a controversial settlement with Purdue. It could delay funds for communities battling addiction.
title: Supreme Court overturns opioid settlement with Purdue Pharma that shielded Sacklers

description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warns of an increased risk of dengue infections in the U.S. this summer. The mosquito-borne virus is surging, and human travel is expanding its reach.
title: Travelers beware: It’s a big year for dengue

description: Despite leads from the public that have poured in over the last three years, there have been no solid answers regarding the 24-year-old geologist’s disappearance in Arizona on June 23, 2021.
title: Daniel Robinson vanished 3 years ago. His father still hopes for his safe return

description: If humanoid robots make you a bit queasy — would it help if they had fleshy faces that can smile at you?
title: A robot gets a face of living ‘skin’ that allows it to smile

description: Iran will hold a runoff presidential election to replace the late hard-line President Ebrahim Raisi, an official said, after an initial vote saw the top candidates not securing an outright win.
title: Iran heads to a runoff election between reformist Pezeshkian and hard-liner Jalili

description: The Colorado teens lobbied the school board for permission to carry and administer Narcan on school grounds and worked with a state representative on a bill to give that right to students statewide.
title: A friend's overdose death turns high school students to activists

description: Almost no aid is getting into Gaza right now. Humanitarian groups continue to sound alarm bells, as deliveries of aid have been stalled because of rising security concerns in the Gaza Strip.
title: Aid workers in Gaza are fighting for survival too

description: After President Biden’s surprisingly weak debate performance this week, some defenders have pointed to other incumbents who stumbled in their first debate but recovered to win reelection.
title: Can Biden come back from a bad debate the way Reagan did in 1984?

description: Problems with the capsule's propulsion system, used to maneuver the spacecraft, prompted NASA and Boeing to delay the flight home several times while they analyzed the trouble.
title: NASA astronauts to extend space station stay as engineers troubleshoot Boeing capsule

description: A judge denied a request to dismiss the involuntary manslaughter case against Alec Baldwin on complaints that key evidence was damaged by the FBI during forensic testing.
title: Alec Baldwin’s case on track for trial in July as judge denies request to dismiss
